alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 3:30PM MDT until July 06 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central San Miguel County in southwestern Colorado... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central San Miguel County This includes the following highways... Colorado 145 between mile markers 73 and 78 in between Sawpit and Telluride. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
